9.1
Do's:- RadiolosicalAluclear Disasters-
Any radiation incident resulting in or having a potential to result in exposures and or
contamination of the workers public or environment in excess of the respective permissible
limit can lead to a nuclear/radiological emergency.
In case ofthefl/loss ofradioactive source from the institution/premises/during transportation,
it would normally be noticed first by the field person responsible for handling the same. TtE
head ofthe concerned organization would be next person to get this information from his
own field person. He in turq would bring the incident to the notice ofthe local police station
as well as to the Atomic Energy Regulatory Board (AERB) who is the regulator (as per
Radiation Protection Rule 2004 under the Atomic Energr Act) for transporlatiorq storages
and use of radiation source in the public domain. This will be the trigger mechanism for
initiating any mitigation processes by the states agencies.
Further in case ofloss/theft ofradioactive sources, the recommended response plan for
recovery/retrieval and disposal of the radiological source would be as follow:
l) 
AERB will inform the crisis Managemenr Group (cMG), DAE through DAE
Emergency control Room (DAE-ECR), contact Details of 24 x 7 operational DAE-
Emergency control Rooms are- main DAE-EcR{022-22023979,022-2z02l7l4,Qtiobile)
09969201364| & alternate DAE *ECR {022-25991070, ozz-zsstszg3, (Mobile)
099692013651). In additio& it is envisaged that the concemed public official will follow
their own soP & intimate the concemed agencies for ensuring appropriate resporrse.
2) 
Expert response agencies (Police /l.lDRF/relevant state authorities) after reaching the
incident spot, if feel that they need an expert ailvice or technical support from nodal ministry
(DAE); tlrey should contact cMG, DAE through DAE-Emergency control room. while
informing, they are requested to provide exact locatiorq contract numbers of concemed
DIWSP/Local police station and details of incident with brief desoiption of rhe object (if
possible, along with photograph taken from the distance).
3) upon receip of such information, the cMG, DAE will get activated and will get in
touch with the local authorities to decide about firther course ofaction.
17:
4) CMG will decide and constitute a team of experts as per requirements. The team of
experts wili be dispatched to the site by quickest means possible.
5) Member Secretary, CMG (who is also the designated Nodal Officer of DAE) will get
regular updates from concemed DAE experts/field agencies and will keep concemed
authorities informed and as per scenario, will also keep MHA Control Roomupdated.
6) DAE experts on recoverylretrieval of the source will examine the integrity of the
radiation source & accordingly, AERB will decide about firther course ofaction regarding
safe keepinldisposal of the material.
7) Responsibility of source transportation of radioactive material from incident site to a
safe storage place should be under taken by local police.
8) If there is local contamination due to radioactive material, decontamination activities
should be taken up by expert resporlse agencies like NDRF and or be performed under
guidance of DAE's technical experts. Local district authorities should provide adequate
resources for handling and transportation of the contaminated material to the safe disposal
site.
9) In case required, media briefing will be done by the designated state offrcial. He may
seek Technical inputs from AERB, if he desires.
10) After recovery/retrieval of the source and after completing of activities related with
decontamination and safe disposal (as per scenario requirements), with due conctnrence of
AERB, the closure of radiological emergency scenario will be declared by the concemed
DT,[/SP.
